comments.body: Shouldn't this be legal? Might be worth referencing an issue if its not.

It should be, but the behavior of `flatiter.__getitem__` is very much inconsistent 
with respect to `ndarray.__getitem__` (case in point: https://github.com/numpy/numpy/issues/17175).

Adding a note is probably a good idea though (see https://github.com/numpy/numpy/pull/17180/commits/edcf0ea581546eb8c29ba34b7576f2a8d81b4eec).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@# boolean indexing is just plain broken (gh-17175)
a[np.bool_()]  # E: No overload variant of "__getitem__"
a[Index()]  # E: No overload variant of "__getitem__"
a[supports_array]  # E: No overload variant of "__getitem__"
